data.prayer: Spirit, help the fearful in Pardubický, Czechia to submit to God and resist the devil.
data.verse: Submit yourselves, then, to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Pardubický, Czechia
data.section_summary: What challenges do people here face?

data.prayer: the state of Pardubický has (about) 3,720 people who know Jesus, 131,693 people who know about him culturally, and 369,187 people who are far from Jesus.
Father, please give the people in the state of Pardubický access to a Bible in their own language.
Jesus, please send your Spirit to Pardubický, so they can have freedom.
data.verse: Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is freedom.

data.prayer: Father, I pray that the Jew, Czech-speaking people will not be afraid or ashamed. Prevent them from being confounded or disappointed in their search for you. May the Jew, Czech-speaking people know you.

Jesus, all authority was given to you, and you commanded all disciples in Pardubický, Czechia to make more disciples, and you promised to be with them. May your power and their obedience make more disciples today.
data.verse: All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me. Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you. And surely I am with you always, to the very end of the age.

data.prayer: Lord, you already know the names of the prophets you want to raise up in Pardubický. Please, raise them up and give them the courage to speak your truth to your church.
data.verse: Before I formed you in the womb I knew you, and before you were born I consecrated you; I appointed you a prophet to the nations.

data.prayer: Father, may the churches in Pardubický, Czechia honor local leaders who work hard for the flock of God.
data.verse: Pay careful attention to yourselves and to all the flock, in which the Holy Spirit has made you overseers, to care for the church of God, which he obtained with his own blood.
